dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's a PwC survey—they've been doing this globally for 25 years, so there's some credibility there. And Mikhail Lomtadze's focus on mobile-first innovation really stood out to respondents.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This award is worthy of everyone in our amazing Kaspi.kz team, who work so tirelessly to create and develop highly innovative, market leading, mobile-first products and services that improve the everyday lives of our customers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he deflected praise to the team, which is smart. But I'm what even is the purpose of this survey?

HostA: But "visionary" is a strong label—every tech CEO claims that these days, doesn't they?

HostA: Hmm, I guess when a firm like PwC coordinates it, you have to take it seriously. Still, surveys can be subjective.

HostA: And it's been running in Kazakhstan for nine years? I had no idea.
